sense.gloss: just as, right after, in the act of, as soon as, at that moment

sdata.j: ↑金↑↓かね↓の↑支払↑↓しはら↓いの↑話↑↓はなし↓がでると、|とたんに|↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑冷静↑↓れいせい↓になる。
sdata.e: As soon as there is any talk of paying, he cools down.

sdata.j: ↑課長↑↓かちょう↓が↑我々↑↓われわれ↓に↑対↑↓たい↓して、あれこれとうるさく↑言↑↓い↓うのを↑止↑↓と↓めた↑途端↑↓|とたん↓に|、↑何↑↓なに↓もかもがスムーズに↑行↑↓い↓き↑始↑↓はじ↓めた。
sdata.e: As soon as our manager got off our backs, everything started to go off without a hitch.

sdata.e: I had hardly left home when it began to rain heavily.

sdata.j: ↑家↑↓いえ↓が↑揺↑↓ゆ↓れるのを↑感↑↓かん↓じた|とたんに|、↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑庭↑↓にわ↓に↑飛↑↓と↓び↑出↑↓だ↓した。
sdata.e: As soon as he felt his house shake, he rushed out into the garden.

sdata.e: Hardly had the rain stopped when the ground began to freeze.

sdata.j: ↑雨↑↓あめ↓が↑止↑↓や↓んだ|とたんに|きれいな↑虹↑↓にじ↓が↑出↑↓で↓た。
sdata.e: No sooner had it stopped raining than a beautiful rainbow appeared.

sdata.e: Scarcely had the rain stopped before a rainbow appeared.

sdata.j: ↑椅子↑↓いす↓に↑深↑↓ふか↓く↑座↑↓すわ↓ってくつろいだ↑途端↑↓|とたん↓に|、↑電話↑↓でんわ↓が↑鳴↑↓な↓った。
sdata.e: No sooner had I sat down and relaxed than the phone rang.

sdata.e: Scarcely had the market opened when the fire broke out.

sdata.e: I had hardly sat down on the bench when I found it had just been painted.
